article.headline: Portland State 78, Howard 49
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Scott Morrison scored 16 points and Paul Hafford added 15 off the bench to lead Portland State to a 78-49 victory over Howard on Thursday. Juma Kamara chipped in with 14 points for the Vikings (9-4), who have won five of their last six games and are undefeated (6-0) at the Stott Center. Darryl Hudson led Howard (5-7) with 12 points. Stanley Greene added 10 points for the Bison, who lost to Oregon State on Tuesday. Portland State jumped on the Bison early, taking a 16-3 lead when Hafford converted a fast-break layup with 12:55 left in the first half. The Vikings extended their lead to 30-12 when Morrison hit a short hook shot in the lane. Portland State led 41-20 at the half and Howard was unable to make it close in the second half. The Vikings, who have beaten the Bison three seasons in a row, shot 60 percent from the field, including 10-of-23 from 3-point range.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
